creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: painted with coat-of-arms, bird crest and motto 'Sola Juvat Virtus', ends with initial 'AS'; center of stand with large floral cornucopia within chain pattern; cover with crest and scroll finial; arms are those of Stewart, 3rd son of Lord Blantyre
text: The initials "AS" along with the coat of arms of the Stewart of Blantyre signify that this sauce tureen was made for the Honorable Alexander Stewart, who succeeded as the 10th Lord Blantyre in 1776. His younger brother Charles, who was in the East India Company and later served on the Supreme Council of Bengal ordered a similar service at the same time.
title: Sauce tureen with arms of Stewart
